Articles.Content:
Greetings from Ubuntu 18.04! I bought myself a new hard drive (which didn't have Windows, so I downloaded Ubuntu) and a hard drive reader. While my computer works, the hard drive reader is about a millimeter too small. So I have not been able to recover my data yet.

If I am unable to recover my data, I will make up a storyline. Maybe I'll transfer my kerbals to GPP or BH to explain the mysterious absence of all my ships.
Ooooh good idea! Or... JUST WIPE IT CLEAN #forgottenspaceprogram

Because I like GPP so much, I am ending this mission report For Now (TM). Even if I can recover my data, I am playing in GPP now. And I will do something cool in it if it kills me. Wait, no, if it kills my computer. It crashes occasionally when going into map mode, but I deleted Scatterer and that helped.

I am currently exploring GPP on Easy Science mode, but tomorrow (or earlier) I'm going to start a new thread. Oh, and I've got a good in-story reason why they were moved out of the Kerbol system.

Edited September 23, 2019 by fulgur
